titles.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to impose an excise tax on certain sales of assets of medical service organizations to managers, etc. of such organization.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 1/6/1993--Introduced. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to impose an excise tax on self-dealing asset transactions between a disqualified person and a medical service organization. Describes such a transaction as any direct or indirect sale or exchange, or leasing, of any medical asset to: (1) any organization manager; (2) any person who performs substantial professional medical services for the organization pursuant to an employment or other contractual arrangement; (3) any family member of such persons; or (4) any 35-percent controlled entity of such persons.
